intro: Doronicum barcense, commonly known as the Barcense leopard's bane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow petals with a distinctive dark central disc. Doronicum barcense thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or grassy alpine habitats.
